description.narrative: USAID and the Moldovan Association of ICT Companies have applied to the Embassy of Sweden for funding of 17,010 MSEK to co-finance a project related to the establishment of an ICT Excellence Center during the period 2016-2019. The intervention aims at enhancing the competitiveness of the Moldovan ICT industry through the creation of an ICT Excellence Center, which is supposed to fill in the gap between the industry needs and the offer of the Technical University by improving the quality of labor force.

USAID och Moldovan Association of ICT Companies (ATIC) har inkommit med en ansökan till ambassaden om finansering av 17,010 MSEK för att gemensamt finansiera ett projekt för att etablera ett utbildningcenter för ICT-sektorn i Moldavien (ICT Excellence Center) under perioden 2016-2019. Insatsen har som mål att öka konkurrenskraften av ICT-industrin i Moldavien genom att sätta upp ett ICT Excellence Center för att överbrygga den klyfta som finns mellan den kompetens som industrin har behov av och den utbildning som utförs av Moldavien Tekniska Universitet.

tag.narrative: 5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

9.3 - Increase the access of small-scale industrial and other enterprises, in particular in developing countries, to financial services, including affordable credit, and their integration into value chains and markets.

9.3 - Öka tillgången för småskaliga industriföretag och andra företag, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, till finansiella tjänster, inklusive överkomliga krediter, samt deras integrering i värdekedjor och marknader.

title.narrative: Beslut om Insats ICT Excellence Center Institutional Building
Beslut om avtalsändring ICT Excellence Center Institutional Building

description.narrative:
The project ‘ICTEC Excellence Centre’ (Tekwill) is carried out the by the Association of IT Companies in Moldova (ATIC). Initially funded by USAID, Sweden joined in the second year of operations, in September 2016. The Swedish funds to the project are channelled through USAID. In addition, ATIC has been very successful in raising financial support from other sources, such as UN Women, UNDP, private sector, and Moldovan public funding. To many people in Moldova, IT companies and tech-students alike, Tekwill has become synonymous to ICT and Innovation. Tekwill has contributed to: - The ICT sector exceeded planned growth expectations as identfied in the ICT Development Strategy 2018-2023, reaching a share of 3.1% of GDP (increase of over 3 times the revenues of annual sales from 2015-2019). The ICT Sector has seen an increase in number of companies (from 1,700 to 2,300) and of the employed staff - from 21,300 people to 29,600 people, ensuring the best level of salary in the economy. - With the fiscal regime of the IT Park, over 600 resident companies registered an average salary of about 1,685 USD (29 thousand MDL per month). Thus, it became the motivation for highly qualified IT engineers to stay in the country, who significantly contributes to economic growth based on digital innovation. - Chisinau was named the city of the year in Southeast Europe for supporting and developing the IT sector. The capital won the "Emerging city of the year in SEE" award. - Further development and implementation of Tekwill in Every School Program, Startup Moldova, regional feasibility, private sector engagement initiative, as well as consolidation of existing Tekwill Academy, Tekwill Academy Kids and Workforce Development initiatives, recharge of FabLab and responsive programs to support ecommerce and IT for non-IT. - Analysis of context and possibility for sub-national extension of Tekwill was conducted. - Moldova Startup Programme encouraged the entrepreneurship ecosystem. The three major programs under one umbrella carry out several projects based on IT innovations: "Digital Upgrade" that provides collaboration between IT and non-IT businesses; "Impact" that researches and identifies problems in key sectors of the national economy and suggest solutions; "Creative Growth" that ensures access to education and professional programs, financing, assistance in piloting business ideas, and connects them to global markets and cooperation with similar programs. In 5 months since the launching, the program helped over 1827 local entrepreneurs. - Due to Covid-19 pandemic, the activities moved online as of March 2020. A study was conducted to identify the impact of Covid-19-pandemic restrictions on the ICT sector. It was noted that the ICT sector managed OK with the new situation and context.
To secure long-term sector growth, Tekwill utilizes a public-private partnership model to forge synergistic relations with the Moldovan Government, private industry, academia, and donors.
The reporting period is October 1, 2019-September 30, 2020 - Year 5 of implementation (USAID-ATIC Agreement)
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
